intro: Leiothrix spergula, commonly known as the lesser spearwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in early summer. The leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a reddish or purple tint on the underside. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks. The plant is often found in temperate regions of Europe and Asia.
